ud5.2:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud5.2:1.3: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Ānanda came out of retreat and went to the Buddha. He bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
ud5.2:1.6: How short-lived was the Blessed One’s mother! For seven days after the Blessed One was born, his mother passed away and was reborn in the host of Joyful Gods.”
ud5.2:2.1: “That’s so true, Ānanda! For the mothers of beings intent of awakening are short-lived.
ud5.2:2.2: Seven days after the beings intent on awakening are born, their mothers pass away and are reborn in the host of Joyful Gods.”
ud5.2:3.1: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud5.2:4.2: all depart, leaving the body behind.
ud5.2:4.3: The skillful, understanding that all is lost,
ud5.2:4.4: would keenly practice the spiritual life.”
